fields.name: errorCode
fields.description: SQL error code

fields.name: sqlState
fields.description: SQL state

fields.name: executionResults
fields.description: Result of execution of commands

records.name: BatchExecuteErrorDetail
records.description: Represents the properties belonging to an `sql:BatchExecuteError`.

fields.name: maxOpenConnections
fields.description:
The maximum number of open connections that the pool is allowed to have including
both idle and in-use connections. The default value is 15 and it can be changed through the
configuration API with the `b7a.sql.pool.maxOpenConnections` key

fields.name: maxConnectionLifeTime
fields.description:
The maximum lifetime (in seconds) of a connection in the pool. The default value is 1800
seconds (30 minutes) and it can be changed through the configuration API with the
`b7a.sql.pool.maxConnectionLifeTime` key. A value of 0 indicates an unlimited maximum
lifetime (infinite lifetime)

fields.name: minIdleConnections
fields.description:
The minimum number of idle connections that the pool tries to maintain in it. The default value
is the same as `maxOpenConnections` and it can be changed through the configuration
API with the `b7a.sql.pool.minIdleConnections` key

records.name: ConnectionPool
records.description:
Represents the properties which are used to configure DB connection pool.
Default values of the fields can be set through the configuration API.

fields.name: errorCode
fields.description: SQL error code

fields.name: sqlState
fields.description: SQL state

records.name: DatabaseErrorDetail
records.description: Represents the properties belonging to an `sql:DatabaseError`.

fields.name: affectedRowCount
fields.description:
Number of rows affected by the execution of the query. It may be one of the following,
(1) A number greater than or equal to zero -- indicates that the command was processed
successfully and is the affected row count in the database that were affected by
the command's execution
(2) A value of the `SUCCESS_NO_INFO` indicates that the command was processed successfully but
that the number of rows affected is unknown
(3) A value of the `EXECUTION_FAILED` indicated the specific command that failed. This can be
returned in `sql:BatchExecuteError` and only if the driver continues to process the
statements after the error occurred

fields.name: lastInsertId
fields.description:
The integer or string generated by the database in response to a query execution.
Typically this will be from an `auto increment` column when inserting a new row. Not all databases
support this feature, and thereby, it can also be `()`

records.name: ExecutionResult
records.description: The result of the query without returning the rows.

fields.name: executionResult
fields.description: Summary of the execution of DML/DLL query

fields.name: queryResult
fields.description: Results from the SQL query

fields.name: customResultIterator
fields.description:
The instance of the custom Ballerina class that is structurally equivalent to
the `customResultIterator` object type. This instance includes a custom implementation
of the `getNextQueryResult` method

returnParameters.description: True if the next result is `queryResult`

methods.name: getNextQueryResult
methods.description:
Updates `executionResult` or `queryResult` with the next result in the result. This will also close the current
results by default.

returnParameters.description: An `sql:Error` if any error occurred while closing

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes the `sql:ProcedureCallResult` object and releases the associated resources.

returnParameters.description: True if the next result is `queryResult`

otherMethods.name: getNextQueryResult
otherMethods.description:
Updates `executionResult` or `queryResult` with the next result in the result. This will also close the current
results by default.

returnParameters.description: An `sql:Error` if any error occurred while closing

otherMethods.name: close
otherMethods.description: Closes the `sql:ProcedureCallResult` object and releases the associated resources.

parameters.name: sqlQuery
parameters.description:
The query which needs to be executed as a `string` or an `sql:ParameterizedQuery` when the SQL query has
params to be passed in

parameters.name: rowType
parameters.description:
The `typedesc` of the record that should be returned as a result. If this is not provided, the default
column names of the query result set will be used for the record attributes

returnParameters.description: Stream of records in the type of `rowType`

methods.name: query
methods.description: Queries the database with the query provided by the user, and returns the result as a stream.

parameters.name: sqlQuery
parameters.description:
The DDL or DML queries such as `INSERT`, `DELETE`, `UPDATE`, etc. as a `string`,
or an `sql:ParameterizedQuery` when the query has params to be passed in

returnParameters.description:
Summary of the SQL update query as an `sql:ExecutionResult` or an `sql:Error`
if any error occurred when executing the query

methods.name: execute
methods.description: Executes the provided DDL or DML SQL query and returns a summary of the execution.

parameters.name: sqlQueries
parameters.description:
The DDL or DML queries such as `INSERT`,`DELETE`, `UPDATE`, etc. as an `sql:ParameterizedQuery`
with an array of values passed in

returnParameters.description:
Summary of the executed SQL queries as an `sql:ExecutionResult[]`, which includes details such as
the `affectedRowCount`, and `lastInsertId`. If one of the commands in the batch fails, this function
will return an `sql:BatchExecuteError`. However, the driver may or may not continue to process the
remaining commands in the batch after a failure. The summary of the executed queries in case of an error
can be accessed as `(<sql:BatchExecuteError> result).detail()?.executionResults`

methods.name: batchExecute
methods.description:
Executes a batch of provided parameterized DDL or DML SQL queries
and returns the summary of the execution.

parameters.name: sqlQuery
parameters.description: The query to execute the SQL stored procedure

parameters.name: rowTypes
parameters.description:
The array of `typedesc` of the records that should be returned as a result. If this is not provided,
the default column names of the query result set will be used for the record attributes

returnParameters.description: Summary of the execution is returned in an `sql:ProcedureCallResult`, or an `sql:Error`

methods.name: call
methods.description: Executes a SQL stored procedure and returns the result as stream and execution summary.

returnParameters.description: Possible error when closing the client

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes the SQL client.

objectTypes.name: CustomResultIterator
objectTypes.description:
The object type that is used as a structure to define a custom class with custom
implementations for nextResult and getNextQueryResult in the connector modules.

parameters.name: typeDesc
parameters.description: Type description of the data that need to be converted

returnParameters.description: The converted ballerina value or Error

methods.name: get
methods.description: Parses returned Char SQL value to ballerina value.

objectTypes.name: OutParameter
objectTypes.description: Represents all OUT parameters used in SQL stored procedure call.

fields.name: strings
fields.description: The separated parts of the sql call query

fields.name: insertions
fields.description: The values that should be filled in between the parts

fields.name: strings
fields.description: The separated parts of the sql query

fields.name: insertions
fields.description: The values that should be filled in between the parts

fields.name: value
fields.description: Value of parameter passed into the SQL statement

objectTypes.name: TypedValue
objectTypes.description:
Represents a parameter for the SQL Client remote functions when a variable needs to be passed
to the remote function.

constants.name: EXECUTION_FAILED
constants.description: Constant indicating that the specific batch statement failed.

constants.name: SUCCESS_NO_INFO
constants.description:
Constant indicating that the specific batch statement executed successfully
but that no count of the number of rows it affected is available.

errors.name: ApplicationError
errors.description: Represents an error originating from application-level causes.

errors.name: Error
errors.description: Defines the common error type for the module.

types.name: BatchExecuteError
types.description: Represents an error occurred when a batch execution is running.

types.name: DatabaseError
types.description:
Represents an error caused by an issue related to database accessibility, erroneous queries, constraint violations,
database resource clean-up, and other similar scenarios.

types.name: Parameter
types.description: Represents all parameters used in SQL stored procedure call.

types.name: Value
types.description: Possible type of parameters that can be passed into the SQL query.

modules.summary:
This module provides the common interface and functionality to interact with a database. The corresponding database
clients can be created by using specific database modules such as "mysql" or using the Java Database Connectivity
module "jdbc".

modules.description: This module provides the common interface and functionality to interact with a database.

records.description: Represents the properties belonging to an `sql:BatchExecuteError`.
Represents the properties which are used to configure DB connection pool.
Represents the properties belonging to an `sql:DatabaseError`.
The result of the query without returning the rows.

constants.description: Constant indicating that the specific batch statement failed.

Constant indicating that the specific batch statement executed successfully
but that no count of the number of rows it affected is available.

errors.description: Represents an error originating from application-level causes.
Defines the common error type for the module.

types.description: Represents an error occurred when a batch execution is running.

Represents an error caused by an issue related to database accessibility, erroneous queries, constraint violations,
database resource clean-up, and other similar scenarios.
Represents all parameters used in SQL stored procedure call.
Possible type of parameters that can be passed into the SQL query.

objectTypes.description:
The object type that is used as a structure to define a custom class with custom
implementations for nextResult and getNextQueryResult in the connector modules.
Represents all OUT parameters used in SQL stored procedure call.

Represents a parameter for the SQL Client remote functions when a variable needs to be passed
to the remote function.
